title: Drawing, "Doorway for a town mansion"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Executed is the left half. Rustic work. Above is an escutcheon. The opening is, above, hemi-circular. Inscribed dimensions. A plan is below.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Doorway for a town mansion".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1717.
